intro: Plagiostachys oblanceolata, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowhead, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features heart-shaped leaves that are often glossy and have a distinct arrowhead shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and wetland restoration projects.
